arch:property.oc:show_val: A stone leveling course consisting of small boulders, wadi/field stones, and cobbles. It is tightly laid without mortar. The surface is relatively even, as comparative levels taken east west across the exposed surface indicated a mean variance of ca. 0.04 m. As the first leveling course beneath the W CP East floor pavers (Tr. 97, 2004, Locus 25), the locus has been assigned to Stage 4.
North end W CP East, area of robbed pavers (Tr. 97, 2004, Locus 23).
Phase V: Late Nabataean CE 1st c. redesign and repairs.
2.00 m north south-by-4.30 m east west.
